episode_evaluation.title: The Mystery of Sleep - What Scientists Still Don't Know

overall_assessment.primary_issue: Severe length shortfall - only 475 words vs 3900+ required
overall_assessment.recommendation: Expand content significantly or treat as episode segment

strengths: Exceptional brand voice alignment with intellectual humility
Strong opening hook that establishes mystery immediately
Excellent use of expert quotes and credible sources
Natural conversational tone perfect for audio
Good SSML markup for audio production
critical_issues: Severely undersized - only 17% of required length
Missing main content segments and detailed exploration
Duration far below target (3.5 vs 27 minutes)
Feels like introduction to episode rather than complete episode
No deep dives into specific sleep mysteries
Lacks progressive complexity and detailed examples
recommendations: EXPAND SIGNIFICANTLY: Add 3400+ more words to reach target length
Develop main segments exploring specific sleep mysteries in detail
Add more scientific examples and case studies
Include listener engagement elements and thought experiments
Develop the Mars analogy and other comparative frameworks
Add concluding segment with actionable insights or experiments

audio_production_notes.volume_consistency: Should be good with current markup

next_steps: Return to script-writer for significant expansion
Focus on developing 3-4 main content segments
Maintain current brand voice and engagement quality
Target 3900-4100 word count for full episode
